sect1.title: The User Interface
sect1.para: &logtracker; is a stand alone application which requires file system access to the log files that it analyzes. When the application is started (see ) a window with some dockable sub-windows is displayed.
A typical view of the application is shown in : At the top of the application frame there is a toolbar with some action buttons:

listitem.para: Loads a configuration file. Configuration files either contain a fully configured &logtracker; instance (see ), or a collection of configured log file parsers (see ).
Saves the actual configuration of the application to a configuration file (see ).
Adds a new dockable file selection window to the application. This special window serves as a starting point for new data pipelines.
The view in was created by starting &logtracker; and pressing this button once.
Opens the dialog box for application wide configuration (see ).
Open the help window and show this document.

sect1.para: All other content is organized in dockable windows. Dockable windows can be resized and moved around by the user by clicking onto their header and dragging them. Some special buttons allow window operations such as minimizing, maximizing, detaching, those windows. A comprehensive description of the possible interactions can be found on the Docking Frames Website.

listitem.para: Lists problems that may have occurred during the processing of the log files.

Serves as a starting point for setting up a new data pipeline. Within this window, log files that are going to be processed and monitored and their log files format are being configured. The processing is launched by pressing the Apply-button.
